content: Yes, the library often hosts events and exhibits related to Dr. Seuss, his life, and work. For example, the library has an extensive collection of Dr. Seuss's original artwork, which is regularly displayed in exhibits. The library also hosts an annual Dr. Seuss Birthday Party in March to celebrate Dr. Seuss's contributions to literature and education. In addition, the library has hosted talks and panels exploring various aspects of Dr. Seuss's work, including his political cartoons and his impact on children's literature. Students, faculty, staff, and the general public are encouraged to attend these events and explore the library's Dr. Seuss Collection.
